main.docTitle: Civil Celebrant of Marriages Appointment Appeal Board Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Board Secretary (秘書) means the Secretary to the Appeal Board appointed under section 5(1);
Chairperson (主席) means the Chairperson of the Appeal Board appointed under section 5J(3) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Deputy Chairperson of the Appeal Board appointed under section 5J(3) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where more than one Deputy Chairperson of the Appeal Board is so appointed, any Deputy Chairperson of the Appeal Board.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Composition of Appeal Board for hearing appeal

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of hearing and determining an appeal, the Appeal Board shall comprise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairperson or Deputy Chairperson; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any 2 members of the Appeal Board appointed under section 5J(3) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Chairperson or Deputy Chairperson shall preside at all proceedings before the Appeal Board.
Every question before the Appeal Board arising in relation to an appeal shall be determined by the opinion of the majority of the persons comprising the Appeal Board for the purposes of that appeal.

If, for any period, the Chairperson is precluded by absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from exercising his functions, the Deputy Chairperson shall act on behalf of the Chairperson and as such to exercise and perform all the functions of the Chairperson during that period.

If 2 or more persons are appointed as Deputy Chairpersons under section 5J(3) of the Ordinance, the Secretary for Security may appoint any one of them to act on behalf of the Chairperson during the period mentioned in subsection (1).
The Secretary for Security shall appoint a person to be the Secretary to the Appeal Board.
The Chairperson may give to the Board Secretary such directions as he thinks fit for the purposes of this Regulation.
The Board Secretary shall comply with any direction given under subsection (2).

section.name: s6
section.heading: Conduct of proceedings
section.content: Subject to this Regulation, the Appeal Board may determine its own procedure for the purposes of hearing and determining an appeal.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Serving of notice
section.content: Where this Regulation authorizes or requires any document or notice to be served, the document or notice may be served in person or sent by post.

subsection.content: An appellant shall commence an appeal by serving on the Board Secretary a notice of appeal in writing.
The notice of appeal shall be served within 90 days after the date on which the appellant was notified of the decision appealed against or within such longer period as the Chairperson may allow.
The notice of appeal shall be in such form as the Chairperson may specify.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: set out the grounds of the appeal and the facts relied on; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include a copy of all the documents the appellant intends to rely on and the particulars of all the witnesses he intends to call at the hearing.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Serving notice of appeal on Registrar
section.content: The Board Secretary shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving a notice of appeal, serve a copy of the notice on the Registrar.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Registrar to prepare summary of facts for Appeal Board
section.leadIn: The Registrar shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after receiving a notice of appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prepare a written summary of the facts of the case and the reasons of the decision appealed against; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve the summary on the Board Secretary and a copy of the summary on the appellant.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Date, time and place of hearing

subsection.content: Upon receipt of a notice of appeal, the Board Secretary shall fix the date, time and place of the hearing.
The Board Secretary shall, not less than 28 days before the date of hearing, serve on the appellant and the Registrar notice of the date, time and place of the hearing.
A notice under subsection (2) shall be in such form as the Chairperson may specify.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Hearings to be in public except in special circumstances

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the hearing of an appeal shall be in public.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with the consent of the parties to an appeal or on application by either party to an appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that it is appropriate to do so,

subsection.continued: by order direct that the whole or any part of the hearing shall take place in private and give directions as to the persons who may be present.

subsection.content: The Appeal Board may, with the consent of the parties to an appeal, determine the appeal without an oral hearing on the basis of written submissions on oath or affirmation only.

subsection.leadIn: At the hearing of an appeal, the appellant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may appear in person; or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be represented by a barrister or a solicitor within the meaning of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with the approval of the Chairperson or the Deputy Chairperson who presides at the hearing, be represented by any other person authorized by the appellant in writing.

subsection.content: The approval required under subsection (1)(b)(ii) shall not be unreasonably withheld.

subsection.leadIn: At the hearing of an appeal, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may appear in person; or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a legal officer within the meaning of the Legal Officers Ordinance (Cap. 87);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a barrister or a solicitor within the meaning of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any public officer of the Immigration Department authorized by him in writing.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Languages
section.content: The hearing of an appeal may be conducted in the English or Chinese language or both as the Appeal Board thinks fit.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Appeal Board not confined to grounds set out in notice of appeal
section.content: The Appeal Board may consider any matter which appears to it to be relevant to the grounds of an appeal notwithstanding that there is no reference to the matter in the notice of appeal.

subsection.content: The Appeal Board may receive and consider any material (whether in the form of oral evidence, written statement, document or otherwise) which appears to it to be relevant to the issues in an appeal notwithstanding that the material would not be admissible as evidence in a court of law.

subsection.leadIn: The Appeal Board may by notice in writing signed by the Chairperson (or the Deputy Chairperson if he is presiding) require any person to attend any hearing of the Appeal Board to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give evidence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produce any document or other thing in that person’s possession, custody or power; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: answer any question,

subsection.continued: relating to any issue in the appeal.

subsection.content: The Appeal Board may administer oaths and affirmations and may examine on oath, affirmation or otherwise any person attending before it.

Every witness in hearings of the Appeal Board shall be entitled to the same privileges in respect of the giving of evidence and the production of any document or other thing as he would be entitled to if appearing as a witness in civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance.

The Appeal Board may allow in respect of a witness who attends a hearing of the Appeal Board a professional witness allowance, expert witness allowance or loss allowance not exceeding the professional witness allowance, expert witness allowance or loss allowance, as the case may be, that may be allowed under the Criminal Procedure (Witnesses’ Allowances) Rules (Cap. 221 sub. leg. B) in respect of a witness.
If a sum allowed under subsection (5) is not claimed within 3 months from the date on which it was allowed, it shall cease to be payable.
An appellant may, at any time, abandon the appeal or any part of the appeal by notice in writing served on the Board Secretary.
An appellant who serves a notice under subsection (1) shall at the same time serve a copy of such notice on the Registrar.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Failure of appellant to attend hearing

subsection.leadIn: If at the time fixed for the hearing of an appeal, the appellant fails to attend the hearing either in person or by a barrister, solicitor or authorized representative, the Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is satisfied that the appellant’s failure to attend was due to illness or any other reasonable cause, postpone or adjourn the hearing for such period as it thinks fit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceed to hear the appeal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by order dismiss the appeal.

subsection.content: Where an appeal is dismissed under subsection (1)(c), the appellant may, within 28 days after the making of the order for dismissal, apply to the Appeal Board for a review of the order by serving a notice in writing on the Board Secretary.
A notice under subsection (2) shall be in such form as the Chairperson may specify.
An appellant who serves a notice under subsection (2) shall at the same time serve a copy of such notice on the Registrar.
The Appeal Board may, if satisfied that the appellant’s failure to attend the hearing was due to illness or any other reasonable cause, set aside the order for dismissal.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Appeal Board sets aside an order for dismissal under subsection (5), the Board Secretary shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fix the date, time and place for a fresh hearing of the appeal so as to enable the hearing to commence as soon as is reasonably practicable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 14 days before the date so fixed serve on the appellant and the Registrar notice of the date, time and place of the hearing.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Record of proceedings
section.content: The Appeal Board shall keep a summary or record of proceedings in every appeal in such form as the Chairperson may specify.

subsection.content: The Appeal Board shall give reasons in writing for its decisions. Those reasons shall include its findings on material questions of fact and a summary of the evidence or other material on which those findings were based.
The Board Secretary shall serve a copy of the Appeal Board’s decision and of the reasons for the decision on the parties to an appeal.
